channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Pod of 'more than 100' dolphins swim and play alongside fishermen's boat off the South Coast
item.description: Friends Ashton Keiditsch, 55, and John Davenport, 48, spotted scores of dolphins swimming by their boat five minutes from Langstone Harbour, near Hayling Island, Portsmouth in Hampshire.

item.title: Roadwork-riddled M20 has been named England's WORST motorway
item.description: A Transport Focus poll of more than 8,000 drivers indicated that the link between London and Dover is the least popular major road in the country - four places below the much-loathed M25.

item.title: Trump admits coronavirus 'will get worse before it gets better' at comeback briefing
item.description: President Donald Trump conceded Tuesday that the worst of COVID-19 is yet to come as he held his first White House coronavirus briefing since April.

item.title: Two Chinese contractors are charged with hacking British biotech firm as they are indicted in the US
item.description: Li Xiaoyu, 34, and Dong Jiazhi, 31, allegedly stole 'hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of trade secrets,Â intellectual property, and valuable business information in a decade-long scheme.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson breaks silence on Princess Beatrice's wedding
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, shared the gushing tribute on Instagram today, writing that she felt 'so lucky with my girls' Princess Beatrice, 31, and Princess Eugenie, 31, following the royal's surprise wedding.

item.title: Mum-of-four, 47, strangled to death by dogs pulling on leads wrapped around her neck in Welsh field
item.description: Mother-of-four Deborah Mary Roberts, 47, was discovered lying face down in grassland with the dog leads around her neck in a grassed area in Wrexham, North Wales.

item.title: Boris Johnson could create a US-style 'spy list' to kick out covert foreign agents
item.description: Boris Johnson could create a US-style 'spy list' to make it illegal to secretly work for a foreign country while in the UK.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Early next month the Queen and Prince Philip will travel 400 miles to the banks of the River Dee and the baronial mansion of Balmoral Castle.

item.title: Home sales recover further from lockdown slump but quarter was worst ever
item.description: Around 63,250 transactions took place in June, nearly a third higher than the 48,000 recorded in May, but the number of homes being sold in the second quarter dipped to its lowest on record.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi brands COVID-19 the 'Trump Virus' and says the president's inaction has made it worseÂ
item.description: Nancy Pelosi, the House Speaker, on Tuesday night gave a new name to COVID-19 - 'Trump virus'. Pelosi told CNN she used the term because she blamed the president for mismanaging the crisis.

item.title: More than 400,000 people are waiting for new passports
item.description: Reduced staffing to allow for social distancing means passport forms are taking longer than usual to process, according to a Home Office minister.

item.title: Tesco staff are told to clean toilets, shelves and floors
item.description: Staff at Tesco Metro and Express supermarkets in the UK will have to take over the responsibilities of professional cleaners from August 24 - a move that will come as a surprise amid coronavirus.

item.title: Global number of coronavirus cases tops 15 million as the pandemic continues to gather pace
item.description: The top five countries with the most cases are the US, Brazil, India, Russia and South Africa. But, the data shows the virus is accelerating fastest in the Americas.

item.title: Earthquake in Alaska: Tsunami warning after enormous 7.8m tremor strikes off coastÂ
item.description: The shallow six-mile wide quake hit Alaska at 6.12am GMT on Wednesday, or 11.25pm PST on Tuesday.

item.title: E scooters could catch fire and explode due to dangerous batteries
item.description: Charity Electrical Safety First (ESF) has revealed that e scooters could catch fire and explode as a trial to introduce the devices in the UK has started in Middlesbrough.

item.title: Ex-engineer at Google says glitch which blocked conservative websites exposed secret internal list
item.description: Mike Wacker, a former Google engineer, says that a brief disappearance of conservative news outlets from the search engine may have revealed the existence of a 'secret blacklist'.

item.title: Kanye West says he has been trying to DIVORCE Kim
item.description: In his latest rambling Twitter outburst, West said Kim was 'out of line' and blasted her mother Kris Jenner as 'Kris Jong-Un' while accusing the pair of 'white supremacy'.

item.title: Couple busted having SEX on WA train - as boyfriend tells court he just 'had to do it!'Â
item.description: Joseph Paul Darcy, 43, and Tracy Hope Hartley, 36, were busted having oral sex and intercourse in the carriage of a train bound forÂ Mandurah, south of Perth, at 8pm on May 9.

item.title: Labour whistleblower settlement expected in High Court today
item.description: The move is part of a settlement designed to draw a line under allegations made during Jeremy Corbyn's leadership that Labour had allowed the overt hatred of Jewish people to fester.

item.title: First-time buyers bought Â£155, 000 home after one 20-minute VIRTUAL viewing
item.description: Jessica Reoch, 27, and her partner Gavin Jack, 28, from Glasgow, bought a two-bed property in the area after one FaceTime viewing after physical tours were banned amid lockdown,

item.title: Mental health in Britain plummets by 10% over lockdown to the worst level in seven years
item.description: Manchester University researchers surveyed 17,500Â people in April and found more than a quarter (27 per cent) had 'significant mental distress'.

item.title: The UK's best secret beaches from Cornwall to Scotland
item.description: With lockdown having eased all over the UK, Britons are flocking to the country's beaches. But mostly to the same ones. This list will help those looking for tranquil spots.

item.title: Portuguese police 'have only 22 more months to make their case against Christian Brueckner'
item.description: Rogerio Alves said 'time is getting short now'Â for prosecutors to make their case against Christian Brueckner while speaking on Â McCann: The Hunt for the Prime Suspect on ITV.

item.title: Twitter BANS 7,000 QAnon accounts and limits ability of 150,000 others to post amid new crackdown
item.description: Twitter launched a crackdown on far-right conspiracy theoryÂ groupÂ QAnon on Tuesday night suspending 7,000 accounts and impacting 150,000 others.

item.title: 'I wish her well': Trump sends message of support to jailed Epstein 'madam'
item.description: The president told reporters he wishes Ghislaine Maxwell well in his Tuesday press conference and admitted to meeting her numerous times.

item.title: Spain 'is on the brink of being declared UNSAFE for Britons'
item.description: This weekend, 4,581 further cases were reported in the country - bringing its total to 264,836. Whitehall sources said Spain's recent outbreaks are being watched.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals why men now have affairs for love while WOMEN do it for sex
item.description: Tracey Cox reveals that the tables have turned and that men are increasingly having affairs because they crave intimacy and affection, while women want selfish sex without complications.

item.title: Home Office staff to receive training on history of migration in the wake of the Windrush scandal
item.description: New and existing staff at the Home Office are set to receive compulsory training in to 'understand and appreciate the history of migration and race in this country'.

item.title: Crafty entrepreneur spends Â£25,000 transforming three-storey townhouse to stunning home in six weeks
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Nuala Campbell, 38, and husband Frankie, 43, bought the Belfast home covered in rotten food, sticky surfaces, and urine-soaked floorboards, for Â£142.000.

item.title: Wife asks husband 'is this true?' as he is confronted by paedophile hunters
item.description: The man was filmed being confronted by Broken Dreams, a self-proclaimed 'group of volunteers who actively seek online predators', outside his house in Buckinghamshire.

item.title: Maxwell joked about 'randy Andy' to Epstein 'as they watched a secret clip of prince and nude woman'
item.description: 'Tiffany Doe', 48, a former employee of Epstein, claims she walked in on the pair in a 'television control room,' dark and packed with screens, at the financier's Â£77million New York penthouse.

item.title: Australian scientists discover tiny larvae of giant sunfish for first time after years of mysteryÂ
item.description: Until a biologist at the Australian Museum extracted DNA from larva found off the New South Wales coast last year, scientists had failed to make the link between the giant fish and its larva.

item.title: Hilarious snaps show English mishaps on things including cushions, toilet signs and restaurant menus
item.description: Reddit users from across the world have shared some of the most amusing spelling mishaps they have come across on items including cushions, safety warnings and restaurant menus.

item.title: The 'sanitisation' station Australians are setting up at their front doors to prevent COVID-19
item.description: Australian families are setting up 'sanitation' stations at their front doors to ensure they are preventing the spread of COVID-19, particularly in Melbourne and Sydney hotspots.

item.title: UK is close to giving up hope of striking post-Brexit trade deal with EU
item.description: The UK is assuming there will not be a post-Brexit trade deal with the EU and will trade with the bloc on WTO terms when the transition period ends on December 31, 2020.

item.title: GCHQ spy, 39, resigns after admitting flashing to woman from his hotel room
item.description: David McGuire, 39, was arrested after the victim took pictures of him naked at the hotel window near the spy HQ in Cheltenham - but he initially believed she was enjoying seeing his genitals.

item.title: Woman shouts at man for breaking social distancing in A CAR
item.description: Owen Smith-Carretero, 21, was driving in Crawley, Sussex, on July 18 when he was met by an irate driver who claimed he had broken social distancing guidelines by pulling his car too close to hers.

item.title: McDonalds murder suspect, 23, is arrested over knife killing
item.description: Peter Petrou, 37, is believed to have been involved in a fight outside a McDonald's restaurant on Kilburn High Road in north London on Thursday night.

item.title: Mum wows after doing a better DIY job cleaning her staircase than professionals
item.description: An Australian woman has wowed the internet after ridding her staircase of marks, despite being told by professional cleaners that they were 'permanently stained'.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Prince Andrew is so irrelevant he was invisible at his daughter's wedding
item.description: We know the Royals don't do things like the rest of us, but Princess Beatrice's wedding last weekend was a first. The father of the bride was nowhere to be seen, writes JANET STREET-PORTER.

item.title: Ellie Bullen reveals what her stomach looked like in the hours and days after giving birthÂ
item.description: Australian food blogger Ellie Bullen has shared photos of her postpartum body in the hours and days after giving birth to her first child.

item.title: Donald Trump 'pressured his ambassador to move British Open to Turnberry golf resort in Scotland'
item.description: President Donald Trump reportedly tried to get the US ambassador to the UK to arrange for the British Open to be held at his golf resort in Scotland, despite a top sponsor previously saying it wasn't possible.

item.title: MI5 'is to be given tough powers to make UK a harder environment for Kremlin spies to operate in'
item.description: The Government plans new counter-espionage legislation which they say will make the UK a 'harder environment for adversaries to operate in,' a Home Office source claimed.

item.title: TikTok video reveals the meaning of symbols on the backs of cosmetics bottles
item.description: The meanings were revealed in a video on TikTok, with an 'M' sign preceded by a number indicating how long a product is safe to use after being opened.

item.title: British tourist tests positive for Covid-19 after flying to Lanzarote
item.description: Spanish authorities have placed the British tourist into quarantine after she tested positive for Covid-19 after flying on holiday to Lanzarote with her husband, file photograph.

item.title: Area 51 photos show mysterious hangar has disappeared
item.description: Gabriel Zeifman took the images earlier this month while flying in hisÂ Cessna 150 right along the border of 'The Box', a term for the no-go zone surrounding Area 51.

item.title: Dementia risk leaps by 30% if you live alone in your 50s and 60s, research saysÂ
item.description: The study by University College London surveyed 21,666 people over the age of 55, with the authors warning that there is a growing number of elderly people living alone.

item.title: Happy Birthday Prince George! Stunning new images taken by Kate Middleton are released
item.description: Prince George, who is celebrating his seventh birthday tomorrow, can be seen grinning broadly from the grounds of Anmer Hall in the portraits snapped by Kate Middleton, 38, and released today.

item.title: Bilbo's bolthole: Hobbit hideaway in an 80-acre forest goes on sale for Â£475,000Â
item.description: This one-bedroomed property, set in 80 acres of woodland near the town of St Clears, Carmarthenshire, is on the market for Â£475,000.

item.title: WWII wreck off Kent coast carrying 1,400 tonnes of munitions needs vital safety work
item.description: The SS Richard Montgomery ran aground on August 20, 1944 after carrying a cargo of 7,000 tonnes of munitions which were due to be landed in France.

item.title: Parents win battle to name their son LUCIFER after registrar tried to ban it
item.description: Chesterfield parents Dan and Mandy Sheldon were told their four-month-old son 'wouldn't succeed in life,' after they tried to name him Lucifer, which is another name for the devil.

item.title: Ukraine's President won freedom for 13 bus hostages by posting clip urging people to watch vegan doc
item.description: Maxim Krovishey, 44, lobbed a grenade out of the vehicle and fired twice at officers during a 12-hour standoff with police after he stormed the bus at around 9.25am in the city of Lutsk.

item.title: German scientists are hosting a 4,000-person indoor concert to study how coronavirus spreads
item.description: Scientists at Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg are recruiting 4,000 people to attend a concert of Tim Bendzkoat a large indoor stadium in Leipzig, Germany, on August 22.

item.title: SARAH VINE: What Princess Beatrice's modest wedding day could teach Meghan Markle
item.description: SARAH VINE: Funny, isn't it, the way things turn out. The wedding of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry could not have been more anticipated - and yet, just two years on, the memories are bittersweet.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard both plead innocence in audio after she 'kicked a door into his head'
item.description: Depp, 57, is suing The Sun at the High Court in London for libel after it called him a 'wife beater' amid allegations that he attacked Heard, 34, during their relationship.

item.title: Mary Berry's fury at cannabis oil adverts that use her face to sell supplementsÂ
item.description: Mary Berry said she was 'shattered' to learn her face was being used in unauthorised adverts to sell cannabis oil and face cream.

item.title: Traces of butter dating back 2,500 years are found on wooden dish at the bottom of a lakeÂ
item.description: Traces of butter dating back 2,500 years have been found at the bottom of a lake. Smears were preserved in a wooden dish discovered at the bottom of Loch Tay, Perth and Kinross.

item.title: Beaming recipients show off their new wigs as kind donors reveal why they donated hair
item.description: When Flo Morrison began to lose her hair, her mum Nikki would collect it from her pillow each morning to stop her seeing it. But thanks to the Little Princess Trust, help is at hand to support children.

item.title: Rachel Riley reveals she came to the aid of a friend suffering domestic abuse during lockdown
item.description: She told The Mirror: 'I've been supporting a friend who I didn't know was in a situation of domestic violence for some years.'

item.title: Lockdown flouter hit with Â£3,000 fine for getting a HAIRCUT after being told to self-isolate
item.description: At Â£3,000, it's far from a snip. But that's the price lockdown flouter Gareth Le Monnier, 37, is paying after he was fined for visiting a hairdresser.

item.title: The kids who cashed in on lockdown and learned the value of saving
item.description: Many struggling families have had to halt pocket money payments after losing their income. But others say pocket money has become a bargaining chip as they attempt to juggle childcare and jobs.

item.title: Russian goalkeeper, 16, back 3 weeks after lightning struck him
item.description: Russian Ivan Zaborovsky, 16, was struck by lighting earlier in July while training with his football team FC Znamya Truda. The moment was captured in a dramatic video.

item.title: Diane Abbott wants Prevent counter-terror programme replaced
item.description: Former Shadow Home Secretary Diane Abbott, pictured, said the Prevent programme should be replaced as its toxic reputation means it is not as effective as it could be at countering terrorism.

item.title: Kim Kardashian is 'devastated' by Kanye West accusations
item.description: Kanye, 43, went on a Twitter rampage on Monday night before deleting almost all of his rambling tweets within an hour of posting them.

item.title: 4m women born in 1950s 'disenfranchised' by pension age change
item.description: Campaigners in London are appealing a High Court ruling as they insist that the change to their state pension age from 60 to 66 is discriminating against them.

item.title: 'Londongrad laundromat': Putin allies have used London to wash illicit Russian money, report warns
item.description: Britain welcomed Putin's cronies 'with open arms' because of the cash they brought with them, the Intelligence and Security Committee (ISC) said.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Pure Tinker, Tailor... all it needed was Smiley with a filterless Senior ServiceÂ
item.description: HENRY DEEDES writes that a darkly lit library off Pall Mall lined with well-thumbed volumes that hosted Tuesday's Intelligence and Security committee meeting was 'pure Tinker, Taylor.'

item.title: Spectacular images show the crystal-like hives of stingless bees
item.description: Researchers from the University of Cambridge and the University of Granada in Spain combined to map out the unique hives.

item.title: England star Jofra Archer hits back at critics for THAT detour home
item.description: JOFRA ARCHER: This whole week has been extremely tough and to spend five days in isolation has given me a lot of thinking time on where I am at. To be stuck in a hotel room was hard.

item.title: RBS ditches toxic name after nearly 300 years
item.description: The lender's efforts to put its chequered past behind it are already approaching hurdles, amid warnings that the taxpayer is facing even heavier losses from its bailout than expected.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: A Â£1.6 TRILLION EU splurge. I was Remain... but what a relief we're out!
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: For as long as I can remember, late night bust-ups have been par for the course at European Union meetings. This week's Brussels summit was in a class of its own.

item.title: Scalding rebuke for years of naivety: EDWARD LUCAS, presents damning verdict on Kremlin interference
item.description: EDWARD LUCAS: As I took my seat in the spartan, bug-swept offices of the intelligence and security committee's anonymous Westminster headquarters in the summer of 2018...

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Lucy Boynton's in rhapsodies over love with Rami MalekÂ
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Oscar-winner Rami Malek is used to being in the spotlight, but on an outing in London with his girlfriend, actress Lucy Boynton he was virtually unrecognisable.

item.title: Ellie Goulding's mother tells of her 'deep hurt' after the singer described her as 'threatening'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Speaking from Birmingham, Ellie Goulding's mother Tracey, 56, said she had no idea why Ellie would call her 'threatening' in an Independent interview.

item.title: Son of former Harrods owner Mohamed Fayed claims his sister set bodyguards on him in the gymÂ
item.description: SEBSASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Omar Fayed alleges he was the victim of a violent attack orchestrated by his sister Camilla and her husband and is claiming Â£100,000 in damages.

item.title: ASK TONY:Â I paid student loan off but payments continued - I lost Â£492
item.description: In October last year I repaid Â£20,000 of my student loan. In January I paid off the rest - around Â£4,000. The Student Loans Company confirmed the debt was paid and gave me a Â£24 refund.

item.title: Retired police offices say they've been spied on and accused of lying
item.description: Around 13,000 former officers receive injury pensions that are paid on top of their police pensions These are paid for life - but only if an officer can no longer work owing to harm suffered in the job.

item.title: How cancelling a car loan can drive you round the bend
item.description: Pay just Â£300 a month and drive off in a brand new car. That's the sales pitch that ignited the motor industry, with millions signing up to buy cars on the never-never.

item.title: Teen stabbed to death at knife awareness course, court hears
item.description: Hakim Sillah, 18, pictured, was stabbed twice with a ten-inch blade while attending a knife awareness course in West London in November 2019, Isleworth Crown Court was told.

item.title: Thugs attack 'vulnerable' man before 'pushing him into canal'
item.description: West Midlands Police have condemned a 'nasty attack,' on a 'vulnerable' man who had a can of beer poured over him before he was pushed into a nearby canal.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: 5,800 more deaths possible, agency warns
item.description: Health officials in Stockholm said another 3,000 deaths were likely, but that there could be almost double that in a worst case scenario.

item.title: Scientists to explore a 425-foot underwater sinkhole off Florida
item.description: Next month, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) will explore the mysterious crevasse, an underwater sinkhole referred to as a 'blue hole', for the first time.

item.title: Divers capture stunning underwater video of a German U-boat
item.description: The scenes were captured by Dive Newquay and show the remains of the submarine called U-102I, part of the 31st U-boat Flotilla that served from 1944 to 1945.

item.title: Emily Atack shares stalker's crude messages on Instagram
item.description: The 30-year-old I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! star took to Instagram late Monday night to share screenshots of the messages she'd received from the man in question.

item.title: Parents of a two-year-old boy who died in hospital are arrested
item.description: The parents of a two-year-old boy who died in hospital have been arrested on suspicion of assault and neglect. Police were called to the boy's home in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire on Friday.

item.title: French Champagne house to build huge winery that produces 400,000 bottles of bubbly a year in Kent
item.description: The French champagne experts at Domaine Evremond identified the Kent countryside as having the perfect conditions for grape growing - thanks to its chalk soils and climate.

item.title: Rishi Sunak urges ministerial 'restraint' on public sector pay
item.description: The Chancellor announced a Comprehensive Spending Review (CSR) to be unveiled in the autumn that will set departmental budgets for the years to come.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'SAGE and COBRA no longer control decisions'
item.description: Speaking to MPs this afternoon, Mr Hancock said the Department of Health now worked with a 'bespoke system' to control coronavirus decision making without meeting with the Cabinet.

item.title: Knifeman jailed for 24 years for stabbing man to death outside a McDonald's
item.description: Momodoulamin Saine, 28, stabbed Asim Khan twice in the stomach outside a McDonald's in Cardiff city centre last July, after Mr Khan's brother had accidentally spilled a drink in a nearby bar.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 110 new fatalities in daily death toll
item.description: Department of Health data suggests 65 Brits are now succumbing to the life-threatening infection each day, down 20 per cent in a week. Health bosses say the official death toll now stands at 45,422.

item.title: Russia Report: Boris Johnson REJECTS Brexit vote investigation
item.description: Boris Johnson today dismissed a demand from an influential committee of MPs to launch a formal investigation into whether Russia interfered in the 2016 EU referendum.

item.title: Woman slaps granddaughter for 'refusing to wear a face mask'
item.description: The Shanghai grandmother was caught on camera savagely hitting her young granddaughter in the face at least three times after the girl allegedly refused to put on a face mask.

item.title: Brown bear beats down front door of home in surveillance video
item.description: The terrifying footage was shared to Twitter by Ohio-based radio presenter Jason Priestas on Saturday, and has already garnered more than 750,000 views.

item.title: MailOnline hops on a BA flight from London City Airport to Ibiza and has a wonderfully peaceful time
item.description: July is high season for Ibiza and it would normally be thrumming with tourists who travel to the party hot spot for sun, sea and unbridled hedonism. Samantha Lewis had a very difference experience.

item.title: Stripey the orphaned zebra finds happiness again after keepers dress up as its motherÂ
item.description: An orphaned baby zebra in Kenya has found happiness once again thanks to his keepers who wear a black and white stripy coat and take it in turns to dress up like its mother.

item.title: Mum installs ELECTRIC clothes line in roof of laundry - complete with a heat lamp, fan and LED light
item.description: A mother has stunned social media, after she uploaded a photo of her new giant electric clothes line in the roof of her laundry. The Australian woman shared her discovery on Facebook.

item.title: Kardashians 'shocked' by Kanye West's presidential rally
item.description: Kim Kardashian and her family have been left 'shocked' and 'upset' after Kanye West, 43, revealed during a rally in South Carolina that he and his wife considered aborting their daughter North.

item.title: Kim is 'furious' Kanye said they were close to aborting North
item.description: The 43-year-old rapper made the shocking abortion revelation during his rambling campaign introduction speech in Charleston, South Carolina on Sunday night.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Kim Kardashian needs to stop Kanye West
item.description: Kanye West needs help. The rap star's performance last night at his supposed 'campaign rally' in Charleston was one of the most shocking and disturbing celebrity meltdowns I've witnessed.
